author: A D Balasubramaniyan
text:
Unlike the two major Dravidian parties – the AIADMK and the DMK -- the Congress ruled Tamil Nadu only for 15 years but only the schemes launched by its chief minister Kamaraj is saving the State, said Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi (VCK) president Thol.Thirumavalavan.

Addressing a public meeting organised by People’s Welfare Front (PWF) here on Friday, he said the alliance was formed “not because we had no other way, but because we wanted to create ‘other way’” he said. “What have the two parties done?” he asked.

Mr.Thirumavalavan added that none other than the constituents of PWF had courage to form an alliance to defeat both the DMK and the AIADMK.

CPI(M) state secretary G.Ramakrishnan dismissed both the DMK and the AIADMK as corrupt and opportunistic.

He said both the parties had to be blamed for the mining frauds that have been taking place in southern Tamil Nadu for the last twenty years.

Students’ death

He blamed the DMK, AIADMK and PMK for the death of three naturopathy college studentsMDMK general secretary Vaiko said that though both DMK and AIADMK had proven vote bank and wherewithal, the people should strengthen the PWF as it aimed to bring about a change.

CPI state secretary R.Mutharasan said the ‘corrupt’ AIADMK regime should be replaced but not with the ‘corrupt’ DMK.

He said that PWF leaders were known for their upright character in public life and never had any blot of corruption charges.
title: What have the Dravidian parties done, asks Thirumavalavan
